Description: Black-topped brown bowl or cup, made of very fine Nile silt, with flat base, slightly convex sides producing a slightly everted rim. The exterior has been combed on a diagonal, and then burnished perpendicular to the combing to create a rippling effect. Interior is rippled vertically on the upper bodyand burnished, the lower part of the interior is scatter burnished only. The rim is milled, but worn.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 16; pl. xii. BB33H) (drawing inaccurate)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
